title: Whyyyyyyy..... D:
body:
A new Kat skin.... 

now if i want to keep my sanity i cant play lol during the lunar revel D: and won't be able to try that awesome Vel'koz skin for ages D:

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=Lord Sesshomaru,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=LcroOArE,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-01-14T01:02:30.760+0000)
>
> Go back to school then

than*, oh the irony

what do you mean?
'Then' is correct?
Can I have the 2 minutes of my life back that I took to read and post to your stupid thread?

"then" refers to a point in time i.e. i  we will do this 'then' that or something in sequence i.e. we will do this, then this, then this etc.
than is used for anything that is neither of the ones pointed out above

I am referring to a point in time? the full sentence would read "if you don't understand, then you should return to school"
just like "if you like her, then you should tell her" in these scenarios the time 'Then' is referring to is not specified however it still refers to an action 
'to take place' and as such still has the connotations of 'time' attached to it.
it doesn't make sense to say "If you like her, than you should ask her out" that sentence would have to be structured differently and read as 
"if you like her, you should tell her, rather than not tell her"
Than is a shortened version of the phrase 'as opposed to'
and as such does not make sense when used in this sentence "go back to school than"
